name: Mushroom Stuffed Chicken Breast
description: Recipe video above. These juicy chicken breasts are stuffed with garlicky mushrooms, spinach leaves and a blanket of oozing melted cheese. Simple to make with just a few ingredients, this is how to transform chicken breast from ho-hum into "ohhh yum!"After this one, try Sun Dried Tomato Stuffed Chicken!
recipeIngredient: 200g / 7 oz  mushrooms (, sliced 3mm (1/8‚Ä≥) thick (~2 heaped cups))
80 g / 3oz  mozzarella (, sliced (or other melting cheese))

recipeInstructions.text: Cut pockets into each chicken breast, being sure not to cut all the way through (see photos in post). Cut on the side with the fold in the meat, to keep the smooth side intact.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut pockets into each chicken breast, being sure not to cut all the way through (see photos in post). Cut on the side with the fold in the meat, to keep the smooth side intact.

recipeInstructions.text: Season the inside and outside of the chicken with half the salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Season the inside and outside of the chicken with half the salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Mushroom filling: Melt butter in a heavy based oven proof skillet over high heat. Add mushrooms and cook for 3 minutes until they start to turn pretty golden. Then add garlic, thyme, remaining salt and pepper and continue cooking for a further 2 minutes until mushrooms are nice and golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Mushroom filling: Melt butter in a heavy based oven proof skillet over high heat. Add mushrooms and cook for 3 minutes until they start to turn pretty golden. Then add garlic, thyme, remaining salt and pepper and continue cooking for a further 2 minutes until mushrooms are nice and golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Add spinach: Add baby spinach and stir until wilted - about 30 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Add spinach: Add baby spinach and stir until wilted - about 30 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Stuff mushroom mixture into the pocket of each chicken, then top with cheese.
recipeInstructions.name: Stuff mushroom mixture into the pocket of each chicken, then top with cheese.

recipeInstructions.text: Seal with toothpicks as best you can ‚Äì it doesn‚Äôt need to be fully sealed like we do with Chicken Kiev. Just mostly sealed.
recipeInstructions.name: Seal with toothpicks as best you can ‚Äì it doesn‚Äôt need to be fully sealed like we do with Chicken Kiev. Just mostly sealed.

recipeInstructions.text: Sear chicken: Give the pan a quick wipe with paper towels. Heat oil over medium high heat. Sear each side of the chicken breast for 1 1/2 minutes until golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Sear chicken: Give the pan a quick wipe with paper towels. Heat oil over medium high heat. Sear each side of the chicken breast for 1 1/2 minutes until golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake 15 minutes: Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 15 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the chicken is 65¬∞C/149¬∞F (chicken flesh, not the mushroom filling).
recipeInstructions.name: Bake 15 minutes: Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 15 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the chicken is 65¬∞C/149¬∞F (chicken flesh, not the mushroom filling).

recipeInstructions.text: Rest 5 minutes: Remove from tray onto a plate, loosely cover with foil and rest for 5 minutes. Serve! Pictured in post with easy creamy Baked Lemon Herb Risotto and baby spinach with Balsamic Dressing.
recipeInstructions.name: Rest 5 minutes: Remove from tray onto a plate, loosely cover with foil and rest for 5 minutes. Serve! Pictured in post with easy creamy Baked Lemon Herb Risotto and baby spinach with Balsamic Dressing.

review.reviewBody: Very simple to make and VERY TASTY. Thanks for another great recipe! You are my go to!
This dish was fantastic!!! Just like every other dish I make from your recipe tin!üòÑ You are the bomb!!‚ù§Ô∏èüëèüèªüëèüèªüëèüèª

This was amazing! Added a shallot with the mushrooms. Used Gruy√®re cheese instead of mozzarella. I pounded the chicken breast flat and rolled it with the filling inside and used toothpicks to seal. Browned extra butter to coat chicken breast while cooking. Yum! Will make again!
This recipe is easy to make and very delicious.  Even my fussy hubby loved it.
V tasty! I used cabbage as had no spinach and used Swiss cheese. Def make again.
This was delicious,  chicken was juicy and cooked perfectly.  Loved it . Thanks Nagi
It was amazing!!!  Used spicy dill and smoked Gouda for cheese. Easy recipe

This is a scrumpilicious recipe. I followed the recipe pretty much. The only thing I changed was the herb that I used. I used tarragon as I love fresh tarragon and saut√©ed mushrooms. In reading some of the reviews I had minimal juices at the bottom of my pan. This was definitely a hit in my house, and I will make it again.
Amazing dinner. Pretty simple to make & great flavors! I used a vintage cheddar instead of mozzarella, and still great!
i would cook in a shallow dish so the juices spread out and are not as deep

This was amazing! First time making it and it won‚Äôt be the last. Hubby loved it, served with cilantro lime rice and green beans. Will follow some ideas from others next time. 
Thank you Nagi for your great recipesü•∞
